intro: Elaeodendron glaucum, commonly known as the blue-leaved elaeodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-gray foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
